intro: Lepicephalus ciliata, commonly known as the hairy lepicephalus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves with fine hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. Its small yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the summer months. Lepicephalus ciliata is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
